properties.description: The identifier of a list must be unique within the chosen scope, or a new value will overwrite the existing one.
properties.label: Key
properties.name: key

properties.description: The namespace for appending a value.
properties.label: Scope
properties.name: scope

properties.description: The value to set under given key.
properties.label: Value
properties.name: value

properties.description: When the specified list doesn't exist, it will be created with the provided value during the append operation.
properties.label: Create value if missing
properties.name: createValueIfMissing

properties.description: When set to true, and the value is a list, it will be added as a single value rather than concatenating the lists.
properties.label: Append a list as a single item
properties.name: appendListAsSingleItem

display.description: The numeric value can be incremented atomically, and the action can be used concurrently from multiple executions.
display.title: Atomic Increment

properties.description: The identifier of a value to increment.
properties.label: Key
properties.name: key

properties.description: The namespace to obtain a value from.
properties.label: Scope
properties.name: scope

properties.description: The value that can be added to the existing numeric value, which may have a negative value.
properties.label: Value to add
properties.name: valueToAdd

properties.description: The identifier of a value to wait for.
properties.label: Key
properties.name: key

properties.description: The namespace to obtain a value from.
properties.label: Scope
properties.name: scope

properties.description: If a value is not found within the specified time, the action returns a null value. Therefore, the maximum wait time should be set accordingly.
properties.label: Timeout (1 to 300 sec)
properties.name: timeout

display.description: Remove a value associated with a key in the specified scope.
display.title: Delete Value

properties.description: The identifier of a value to delete, stored earlier in the selected scope.
properties.label: Key
properties.name: key

properties.description: The namespace to delete a value from. The value should have been previously accessible, either in the present workflow execution, or the workflow itself for all the executions, or the user account for all the workflows the user has.
properties.label: Scope
properties.name: scope

display.description: Delete a value from the given index in a list.
display.title: Delete Value from List

properties.description: The identifier of a list to delete value from, stored earlier in the selected scope.
properties.label: Key
properties.name: key

properties.description: The namespace to delete a value from. The value should have been previously accessible, either in the present workflow execution, or the workflow itself for all the executions, or the user account for all the workflows the user has.
properties.label: Scope
properties.name: scope

properties.description: The specified index in the list will be removed, and if it doesn't exist, the list will remain unaltered.
properties.label: Index
properties.name: index

display.description: Retrieve all the currently existing keys from storage, along with their values within the provided scope.
display.title: Get All Keys

properties.description: The namespace to get keys from.
properties.label: Scope
properties.name: scope

properties.description: The identifier of a value to get, stored earlier in the selected scope.
properties.label: Key
properties.name: key

properties.description: The namespace to get a value from. The value should have been previously accessible, either in the present workflow execution, or the workflow itself for all the executions, or the user account for all the workflows the user has.
properties.label: Scope
properties.name: scope

properties.description: The default value to return if no value exists under the given key.
properties.label: Default value
properties.name: defaultValue

display.description: Set a value under a key, in the specified scope.
display.title: Set Value

properties.description: The identifier of a value. Must be unique across all keys within the chosen scope to prevent overwriting the existing value with a new one. Also, it must be less than 1024 bytes in length.
properties.label: Key
properties.name: key

properties.description: The namespace to set a value in. The value should have been previously accessible, either in the present workflow execution, or the workflow itself for all the executions, or the user account for all the workflows the user has.
properties.label: Scope
properties.name: scope

properties.description: The value to set under the specified key.
properties.label: Value
properties.name: value

display.description: Set value under a specified index in a list.
display.title: Set Value in List

properties.description: The identifier of a list. Must be unique across all keys within the chosen scope to prevent overwriting the existing value with a new one. Also, it must be less than 1024 bytes in length.
properties.label: Key
properties.name: key

properties.description: The namespace to set a value in. The value should have been previously accessible, either in the present workflow execution, or the workflow itself for all the executions, or the user account for all the workflows the user has.
properties.label: Scope
properties.name: scope

properties.description: The index in a list to set a value under. The previous value will be overridden.
properties.label: Index
properties.name: index

properties.description: The value to set under the specified list's key.
properties.label: Value
properties.name: value

display.description: Using the Data Storage component, you can easily manage and operate on lists and objects by setting or retrieving any desired data. This process employs a key-value store mechanism, where the key represents the field's name and the value corresponds to the particular data's actual value.
display.title: Data Storage
